data.enText: the complete control of trade in particular goods or the supply of a particular service; a type of goods or a service that is controlled in this way
data.chText: 垄断；专营服务；被垄断的商品（或服务）

data.enText: In the past central government had a monopoly on television broadcasting.
data.chText: 过去，中央政府对电视节目播放实行垄断。

data.enText: Electricity, gas and water were considered to be natural monopolies.
data.chText: 电、煤气和水垄断经营过去被认为是理所当然的。

data.enText: the complete control, possession or use of sth; a thing that belongs only to one person or group and that other people cannot share
Managers do not have a monopoly on stress.
data.chText: 并不只是经营管理者有压力。

data.enText: A good education should not be the monopoly of the rich.
data.chText: 良好的教育不应该成为富人的专利。

data.enText: a board game in which players have to pretend to buy and sell land and houses, using pieces of paper that look like money
data.chText: “大富翁”（棋类游戏，游戏者以玩具钞票买卖房地产）

means: “大富翁”(棋类游戏，游戏者以玩具钞票买卖房地产)

tr: exclusive control or possession of something
example: They have no monopoly on intelligence

tr: (economics) a market in which there are many buyers but only one seller
example: when you have a monopoly you can ask any price you like

example.ex: ...Russian moves to end a state monopoly on land ownership.
example.tran: 俄国人采取的终止国家垄断土地所有权的措施

example.ex: ...the governing party's monopoly over the media.

gramarinfo.label: oft with poss, oft N <l>on/over</l> n/-ing

value.def: If a company, person, or state has a monopoly on something such as an industry, they have complete control over it, so that it is impossible for others to become involved in it.
A monopoly is a company which is the only one providing a particular product or service.

example.ex: Women do not have a monopoly on feelings of betrayal.
example.tran: 被出卖的感觉并非只有女性才有。

value.def: If you say that someone does not have a monopoly on something, you mean that they are not the only person who has that thing.

partsOfSpeech.dec: mono- 单个 + ton 声 + -ous ...的
